intro: Brachycorythis crassicornis, commonly known as the broad-horned brachycoryth, is a species of aquatic plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats such as lakes and ponds. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and broad, dark green leaves that are often coated in a waxy layer. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, arranged in clusters at the base of the plant. Brachycorythis crassicornis plays a role in stabilizing aquatic sediments and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
